68BC476C4B62497FBAAD41A17B8FFD44.description: The student works productively with others in teams. The student is expected to offer ideas or judgments that are purposeful in moving the team toward goals, ask relevant and insightful questions, tolerate a range of positions and ambiguity in decision making, and evaluate the work of the group based on agreed-upon criteria.

7B8F6BDC7B7646F5A9C73AA3684B5E30.description: The student makes oral presentations. The student is expected to use proper conventions of language and presentation.

D4F5E46DE68B4447B7DE8DF1E38DE05A.description: produce a document of sufficient length and complexity to address the topic.

703D3832FD3A4A3CB31391BE9FA5C4D2.description: document sources and format written materials using a style manual such as Modern Language Association; and

CEF98C386B644212A6E1F7C9C3E0ED7F.description: develop an argument that incorporates the complexities of and discrepancies in information from multiple sources and perspectives while anticipating and refuting counter-arguments;

5AB8484F509F49DAB8954B00989ED55F.description: use a variety of formats and rhetorical strategies to argue for the thesis;

C5FC1AC0490F459DADAB0B7095171B95.description: provide an analysis that supports and develops personal opinions, as opposed to simply restating existing information;

022FEDADC1C8447789AB45A7F07CED64.description: synthesize research into an extended written or oral presentation;

DB2FFD555CC3420A8139AEE726DA2F04.description: The student organizes and presents ideas and information according to the purpose of the research and the audience. The student is expected to:

8C7DF22D906E45C791CCB14983F8402E.description: The student spells correctly. The student is expected to spell correctly, including using various resources to determine and check correct spellings.

6F41853B07B7476E98D6041BA965A950.description: The student writes legibly and uses appropriate capitalization and punctuation conventions in compositions. The student is expected to correctly and consistently use conventions of punctuation and capitalization.

35C89CDBBCB64A2D9A68D9E76A852240.description: use a variety of correctly structured sentences such as compound, complex, or compound-complex.

F59CF5E905C9430FBF3F814E76C96782.description: understand and use adjectival, noun, or adverbial clauses and phrases; and

923601D158C84E4E829CC84250C95DA0.description: The student understands the function of and uses the conventions of academic language when speaking and writing. The student continues to apply the knowledge and skills in paragraphs (2)-(12) with greater complexity. The student is expected to:

14D8261312B24015898360254EA3CAD8.description: produce a multimedia presentation such as a documentary, class newspaper, docudrama, infomercial, or visual or textual parody that includes graphics, images, and sound and appeals to a specific audience.

7C8227759B7C470D94A86FB4F5C7E1EF.description: write procedural and work-related documents such as resumes, proposals, college applications, or operation manuals that include a clearly stated purpose combined with a well-supported viewpoint on the topic; appropriate formatting structures such as headings, graphics, or white space; and accurate technical information; and

23F9696F91E64756B2999863C2B9DADC.description: write an analytical essay of sufficient length that includes effective introductory, concluding, and supporting paragraphs that incorporate relevant perspectives and evidence;

A2D950F9DB8E4110B8106ABC1F6C705D.description: The student writes expository and procedural or work-related texts to communicate ideas and information to specific audiences for specific purposes. The student is expected to:

69466C3A34064BADA1B962EEBFFDEA11.description: revise a final draft in response to feedback from peers and teacher and publish written work for appropriate audiences.

30C240FA171E460FA170C6F6153E2D63.description: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling; and

4EE2F811F5AD42B687593474AC20FF2A.description: revise drafts to clarify meaning, consistency of tone, and logical organization;

72B1B8E685C246F79A5BBFBBF1BF0969.description: structure ideas in persuasive ways such as using outlines, note taking, graphic organizers, or lists to develop drafts in timed and open-ended situations;

3B38A7789C3747E7A4441E63A6302B60.description: plan a first draft by selecting the correct genre for conveying the intended meaning to multiple audiences; determining appropriate topics through a range of strategies such as discussion, background reading, personal interests, or interviews; and developing a thesis or controlling idea;

F0638679B18F4B52A1872EDB841552F9.description: The student uses elements of the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing) to compose text. The student is expected to:

22D9D702BD2149E9B2ECDD958059F18A.description: evaluate changes in formality and tone across various media for different audiences and purposes.

1E095DB105944001A8D5FD5B09BF6E5D.description: evaluate how one issue or event is represented across various media to understand the notions of bias, audience, and purpose; and

9B198B58D9D642CAAFC28D9ECFF7BFCF.description: evaluate the interactions of different techniques used in multi-layered media such as layout, pictures, typeface in print media, images, text, or sound in electronic journalism;

678F8A85769945D2B940B037D0809B78.description: evaluate how messages presented in media reflect social and cultural views in ways different from traditional texts;

B0D30FF17B634FA49603164FFD943B2E.description: The student uses comprehension skills to analyze how words, images, graphics, and sounds work together in various forms to impact meaning. The student applies the knowledge and skills in paragraphs (2)-(9) of this subsection with greater depth in increasingly more complex texts. The student is expected to:

5B033385789A49AE96A5B722CD3FCB44.description: evaluate the structures of text for the effectiveness of their graphic representations.

B8FF3C2871D94E5AAE176D8B2730E208.description: evaluate the structures of text such as format or headers for their clarity and organizational coherence; and

09BE840A45964828817DD52F6B3AE608.description: draw conclusions about how the patterns of organization and hierarchic structures support the understandability of text;

ED30E5054F86463E9550BA03FCED9869.description: The student understands how to collect and use information in procedural texts and documents. The student is expected to:

07668A8B051D4633A5CD5713133E6E64.description: present the portfolio to interested stakeholders.

B0B9424471484028AD0024ADA8EC4CA8.description: extended learning experiences such as community service and active participation in career and technical student organizations;

A59D176E9B8F48AD9CF71D9FFFED1CCF.description: prepare a professional electronic portfolio that includes information such as:

26FF94EC83BF45AC96929E1191C5037C.description: The student documents technical knowledge and skills. The student is expected to:

9EDF87DED9FD4E5CAC96239CD9E0DE71.description: produce a business report containing text and graphics; and

BD23C0F21CBC4529AAF407BF174C8A37.description: compose business letters and memos using the appropriate organizational strategies;

2945CB12DF564D6D8892424FA162A000.description: compose positive, negative, and persuasive messages;

BEFCFEF4D44341D6A1EC83A7EC9ED263.description: demonstrate basic writing skills through assigned tasks;

9551652DE1EC45759A6B5AC7B81F2B6E.description: The student produces business documents using current and emerging technology. The student is expected to:

B3542DBEC1104C96BA3BF95F418BF470.description: discuss potential communication problems in multicultural business environments.

8812AB593BF945A89E7A560A49B56D3A.description: identify ways to improve communication in organizations; and

9F21AC7612674A8CACAFFF66469FA857.description: illustrate the impact of nonverbal communication on the total communication process;

8AC38DDB4D3D40E7B25709A971F84FCC.description: interpret nonverbal communication in various activities;

08A93DE6D5E34250B0B5897C0EA22CBB.description: discern appropriate channels for transmitting messages;

F352A4FA053C41BA95BD374B7988FE28.description: assess the ethical and legal implications of messages;

79991A6A3BAB46DD8FE757C7C6B39DFA.description: The student develops communication skills necessary to address a changing business environment. The student is expected to:

7B6FBEAE09CD43C097F6936CC0FDD47E.description: apply proper business interviewing techniques in various situations such as one-on-one, group, and committee interviews.

2C95DCF9CDE64A0AAE9848ACD5F4A5C7.description: demonstrate the ability to give oral instructions for completing a simple task; and

C3D9B42D4417417C8F73CAF7375C593F.description: display active listening through oral feedback;

01D483C20F67402CA40C8585BF49D0CE.description: demonstrate the ability to listen by writing summaries of presentations and oral conversations;

8B292523363740429399FBAD2D796FAE.description: apply effective communication techniques when using the telephone and different forms of technology;

1F6331B0B36A4998BB6BBC4B407838C0.description: deliver an effective business presentation such as sales, reports, and proposals;

FF9AA394A1624DA5893690FFBB3DD638.description: The student illustrates proficiency in interpersonal communication. The student is expected to:

0CFBF992740543B6BCEC34036760C51F.description: apply appropriate business ethics and correct etiquette when using telecommunications.

AECA1E42FA344CF9A5BF13768EFEEA8F.description: evaluate which telecommunications methods are most appropriate to a given situation; and

275AC11ECB9C4BF7ABFBAE9D239B2DDC.description: The student exchanges information via telecommunications such as email, images, social media, and other online information services with appropriate supervision. The student is expected to:

C07C00346EEA48A8A8B3507D2223E848.description: create a business project incorporating data imported from various sources.

903D31A146A34133BB14152F8ECA2E7C.description: conduct interviews to obtain resource materials;

D2CE334880F34D23B4B349BD42B0BEB9.description: design, conduct, and analyze the results of a survey;

EB0DD1E956484E7A8CA967FDDCE16D61.description: incorporate information from printed copies and electronic resources and references;

46DF4E18FFF244E3BE1BF9FEE9AB8353.description: The student employs appropriate research techniques to produce effective business communication. The student is expected to:

15EAE0DC0C124C5D866AC25924A39C93.description: organize ideas in writing in a coherent, logical progression.

972320BB56214C0CB4F9931BF5A2CF74.description: employ precise language to communicate ideas clearly and concisely;

2CF3820F345D4E8B8323EFE690CB42B9.description: interpret visual materials such as charts, graphs, pictures, and maps and translate the information into textual form;

3E798671EBBB427C90AB11669BA318A3.description: distinguish communicated fact from opinion by identifying key words;

BE12DD0C2E58455C831A3E0532FED84C.description: The student prepares for effective communication skills. The student is expected to:

84EA30B8A95947EB884B2DD48C8604E0.description: demonstrate time-management skills by prioritizing tasks, following schedules, and tending to goal-relevant activities in a way that uses time wisely and optimizes efficiency and results.

6B1C6FD11A9042CC8E2B3E944682CD1E.description: show integrity by choosing the ethical course of action and comply with all applicable rules, laws, and regulations; and

A680223D60714902B8E7F4E845358A73.description: demonstrate a positive, productive work ethic by performing assigned tasks as directed;

C6ACAED7D37548239F8D0C92C2571E98.description: demonstrate professionalism by conducting oneself in a manner appropriate for the profession and workplace;

A6DBB78D8AF34C8BA1655FF84F884175.description: communicate effectively with others using oral and written skills;

94EDB1F3DCC34221868815AF76394F41.description: The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and industry. The student is expected to:
